alert.note: Alert for Cassia (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 5:06PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following county, Cassia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause rural and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakley Reservoir, Bostetter Ranger Station, and the old Badger Fire. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
